paper.title: Quantum-inspired variational algorithms for partial differential equations: application to financial derivative pricing
paper.abstract: Variational quantum Monte Carlo (VMC) combined with neural-network quantum states offers a novel angle of attack on the curse-of-dimensionality encountered in a particular class of partial differential equations (PDEs); namely, the real- and imaginary time-dependent Schrodinger equation. In this paper, we present a simple generalization of VMC applicable to arbitrary time-dependent PDEs, showcasing the technique in the multi-asset Black-Scholes PDE for pricing European options contingent on many correlated underlying assets.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是量子启发的变分算法，应用于解决多资产Black-Scholes PDE，用于定价欧洲期权，这直接属于衍生品定价领域。
